Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl with a flattened base, straight mouth and thickened lip of rather crude manufacture. The red-brown surface does not bear a slip. Very irregular, the surface does not appear to have been subjected to much work, though some marks indicate that it would originally have been burnished. Some dark patches were created by fire clouding. The contour of the mouth is irregular.
